questions.question: We ……………………………….. here for two hours.
questions.description: Use the present perfect continuous tense to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present and is still continuing.

questions.question: I ………………………….. to the movies once a month.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about habits, routines etc.

questions.question: The train …………………………… the station at
questions.description: Left is the past simple and past perfect form of leave.

questions.question: He ……………………………….. a few miles away from the railway station.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about permanent arrangements like living places.

questions.question: The road to the left ……………………………… to his house.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: I …………………………….. here for two weeks.

questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: The weather …………………………… good today.

questions.description: The present perfect cannot be used with past time expressions.

questions.question: I first ……………………………… her in a park.

questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions and situations that are happening at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: ‘Where is John?’ ‘He ………………….. out five minutes ago.’
questions.description: To say that something happened at a particular point of time in the past, we use the past simple tense.

questions.question: The baby ...................... since morning.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use the present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: My son ..................... to be a doctor.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about our likes, preferences, needs and wants.

questions.question: The soup …………………. awful.
questions.description: Taste is one of those verbs that are not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I ....................... him at the club yesterday.
questions.description: The present perfect tense cannot be used with past time adverbs like yesterday or last year.

questions.question: He used to visit us every week, but now he .......................
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about facts and habits.

questions.question: The guests ..................... they are sitting in the garden.
questions.description: Present perfect is the most common tense for giving news of recent events.

questions.question: I know every scene in that film because I ..................... it several times.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about a past event whose effect is still felt in the present.

questions.question: I have a friend who .......................... in a pub.
We ………………… the railway station before the train arrived.
questions.description: When we talk about two past events, we use the past perfect for the earlier of the two actions.

questions.question: He …………………. here.
questions.description: We use 'does' when the subject is a singular noun or pronoun.

questions.question: He ...................... working in the film industry for twenty five years by next January.

questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: Edison ……………… newspapers before he became a highly successful inventor.

questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about future events when the arrangement already exists.

questions.question: They ..................... living in this city for twenty years.
questions.description: We use the present perfect continuous tense to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: We …………………. here for ten years now.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is also used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about habitual actions in the present.

questions.question: Bears often ..................... in caves.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about facts.

questions.description: When the subject is a singular noun, the verb takes the marker -s.
